Gudenberg Collection MC.296Collection processed by Stacey FlattNew York University ArchivesNew York University ArchivesElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2641university-archives@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-08-08T19:19:27Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New York University Archives
Harry R. Gudenberg Collection
Gudenberg, Harry R.
Gudenberg, Harry R.
MC.296
.25 Linear Feet in 1 folder in shared housing
1957-1961 The Harry R. Gudenberg Collection contains a 1957-1958 NYU Log booklet, a "1961 NYU Frosh" pin, and a program for the 1958 NYU School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance Evening Freshman Orientation event. Gudenberg was a student at NYU, serving as the Junior Class Secretary-Treasurer for the Evening Student Council in 1958. Materials are in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Henry Gudenberg in August 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.071.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
Harry R. Gudenberg was born in 1933. He graduated with a Bachelor of Science from New York University in 1960 and received his Master of Business Administration from New York University in 1964. He went on to receive a Juris Doctor from Seton Hall University in 1970. He has worked as an arbitrator and mediator.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Harry R. Gudenberg Collection; MC 296; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were housed in an acid-free folder and shared box.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains Henry R. Gudenberg's 1958 NYU School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance Evening Freshman Orientation program of events, a 1957-1958 NYU Log booklet which provided in-coming students with basic school information and activities, and a "1961 NYU Frosh" pin.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository.
Booklets. Buttons (information artifacts). Programs (documents). Gudenberg, Harry R. New York University. School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance.
